synopsis.text: This short animation by Kaori Iwase centers around an elderly woman and her beloved goldfish. Through glimpses of a dream, we learn that her affection for goldfish stems from a childhood experience: when she was a young girl, she won a goldfish at a summer festival. She delighted in caring for her new pet fish. However, one day it disappeared from its bowl, leaving her heartbroken. Years later, the old woman still adores her goldfish companion. The bittersweet memory of her childhood fish remains close to her heart. This film explores the bonds between humans and animals while reflecting on the fleeting yet impactful moments of youth. With vivid emotion and nostalgia, it highlights how small experiences can shape one's lifelong passions.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
